entry.title: You Gotta Take It From Me (I'm Gonna Take It From You)
entry.summary:
Author: Starless_Void

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 32,311Chapters: 18/?Kudos: 162

Summary: Jason makes his way back to Gotham about a year after his big fight with Bruce. He hunkers down in a new apartment, staying as far under the radar as possible to avoid any contact with the Bats- who would probably throw him in Arkham the first chance they got. If only that were his only problem. On top of staying out of the attention of the most paranoid people on the planet, Jason is trying to find a way to undo a stupid spell that has left him in a rather strange state. Returning to Gotham is probably up there in the stupidest decisions he's ever made, but it's his home too. As long as he lays low, doesn't rebuild his criminal empire, and keeps to himself, there shouldn't be any reason for the Bats to bother him.   Dick Grayson has lost Jason twice now. There won't be a third.

entry.title: My little Robin
entry.summary:
Author: VanyKruemelPendragon

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 223,441Chapters: 52/52Kudos: 305

Summary: After Robin got kidnapped, ages ago, for the ploy of a love sick Talia, for proposing to Bruce in their twisted way, she'd come to Dick, desperate, alone, pretending to be broken.Dick, just fired as Robin, with a replacement lined up, doesn't believe one word she says, until she starts being honest. Until he sees a way to handle his hurt feelings.Three years later, she's back. Not broken, not quite as desperate, and yet honest, again. Honest how she's afraid of her position as heir to the League, with an actual male heir around. Honest about her wish to get rid of said heir.Dick has no choice, not really. He has to take Damian in. It's his son, after all. Fic is fully written and will be uploaded chapter by chapter. Upload every Wednesday and Sunday. Which means this will be done... December 31st, if I do daily uploads in the Christmas weeks. It'll allow you to read the last chapter, which is set shortly after midnight, on New Year's Day, after midnight ;)

entry.title: Like a Ricochet
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,037Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 1

Summary: Jason stands over Roy Harper's prone form, his hands at his sides, echoes of his past ricocheting around the corridors of his mind. In his mind's eye he sees the man Roy once was; the smiling face, the teasing tone, the crystal clear gaze of his eyes. Then he sees who Roy had become, falling prey to his own demons, to the promise of something chemical to chase them away. He remembers, too, standing over Roy in an alley just like this one, finding him after two days of silence, high as a kite, right on the edge of an overdose.

entry.title: What It Sounds Like
entry.summary:
Author: UltraCaffeinatedIvy

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,823Chapters: 9/14Kudos: 96

Summary: Things are mostly looking up for Jason Todd. He’s finally earned a scholarship to Gotham Academy and has a place that actually feels like home. He knows it's not some kind of cosmic reward for getting through a rough past, living through Catherine's addictions, his dad up and disappearing, or any of the other shit he's had to put up with. You get dealt your hand in life, for better or —more likley— worse, and try to make the best of it. Then Dick Grayson steps in. Or Where Pamela Isley adopts Jason Todd. Enrolls him in Gotham Academy and Jason struggles being a normal teenager, having friends and, of course, falls in love with Dick Grayson in the process. A coming of age story.

Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,000Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 38

Summary: When the Red Hood, an unknown crime lord with deep power in Gotham, offers Roy a chance to clear all his debts, it’s a tough choice. Roy needs the debts cleared desperately so he can start his new life with his long time boyfriend Dick Grayson, but the cost? Giving Dick over to the Red Hood for Christmas Day. Jason accepts this situation for what it is – a Christmas fucking miracle where he can now play out all his sordid teenage fantasies with the object of his affections, his one-time older brother Dick Grayson.

Summary: It starts with Dick forgetting his keys. It’s something Jason easily brushes aside, even when Dick forgets to get groceries and of all things his shoes one day it’s something they can chalk up to stress or lack of sleep. entry.title: performing, or living
entry.summary:
Author: chasm_side

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 47,625Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 271

Summary: "Everyone tells themselves little stories about who they are," she told him. "Stories about why they do what they do, why they want what they want. And that's fine—telling a story isn't the same as telling a lie, you know?" "Sure," Dick agreed. "It only gets fucked up when you start thinking your story is the only story worth believing," Jay said. "That you've got some kind of monopoly on truth, that you're the only person who gets to tell other people what's really real. So… you let me have my little stories, and I'll let you have yours. If you need to believe in Batman, if you need Bruce to be a good father, if you need to roll around in your shame about not being honest with Daddy about all the awesome sex you're having with the most problematic of Daddy's problem children—I mean, sure, whatever gets you off, right?"Or, the long and winding aftermath of Jay's involuntary magical sex change.

entry.title: You Are Out of My League
entry.summary:
Author: ivebeenbamboozled (brainwitchletty)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 648,702Chapters: 59/60Kudos: 1,693

Summary: The story begins with a new Robin to replace the old, with Nightwing none the wiser to being replaced at all, and suddenly he has a little brother within the same terrible day. It takes a while to accept, but Dick quickly learns this new Robin-- Jason Todd-- is exactly what Dick Grayson was always missing in his life, and in many more ways than one. Through the years with the team and working with the Justice League, Jason finds a place for himself and becomes a vital member of the Young Justice League while also becoming a vital centerpiece in Dick's life. And when all that ends-- when Jason Todd is taken away from Dick-- it's going to be even harder to put his life back together with that emptiness returning once more. . . . Mostly canon compliant story detailing Jason's introduction to the Young Justice League as Robin, his eventual death, and Dick discovering the mysterious red-hooded figure acting as Ra's Al Ghul's bodyguard is a lot more familiar than he should be.
